    1854             : 
    1855             : namespace nlohmann
    1856             : {
    1857             : namespace detail
    1858             : {
    1859             : ///////////
    1860             : // lexer //
    1861             : ///////////
    1862             : 
    1863             : /*!
    1864             : @brief lexical analysis
    1865             : 
    1866             : This class organizes the lexical analysis during JSON deserialization.
    1867             : */
    1868             : template<typename BasicJsonType>
    1869           5 : class lexer
    1870             : {
    1871             :     using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
    1872             :     using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
    1873             :     using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
    1874             :     using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
    1875             : 
    1876             :   public:
    1877             :     /// token types for the parser
    1878             :     enum class token_type
    1879             :     {
    1880             :         uninitialized,    ///< indicating the scanner is uninitialized
    1881             :         literal_true,     ///< the `true` literal
    1882             :         literal_false,    ///< the `false` literal
    1883             :         literal_null,     ///< the `null` literal
    1884             :         value_string,     ///< a string -- use get_string() for actual value
    1885             :         value_unsigned,   ///< an unsigned integer -- use get_number_unsigned() for actual value
    1886             :         value_integer,    ///< a signed integer -- use get_number_integer() for actual value
    1887             :         value_float,      ///< an floating point number -- use get_number_float() for actual value
    1888             :         begin_array,      ///< the character for array begin `[`
    1889             :         begin_object,     ///< the character for object begin `{`
    1890             :         end_array,        ///< the character for array end `]`
    1891             :         end_object,       ///< the character for object end `}`
    1892             :         name_separator,   ///< the name separator `:`
    1893             :         value_separator,  ///< the value separator `,`
    1894             :         parse_error,      ///< indicating a parse error
    1895             :         end_of_input,     ///< indicating the end of the input buffer
    1896             :         literal_or_value  ///< a literal or the begin of a value (only for diagnostics)
    1897             :     };
    1898             : 
    1899             :     /// return name of values of type token_type (only used for errors)
    1900           0 :     static const char* token_type_name(const token_type t) noexcept
    1901             :     {
    1902           0 :         switch (t)
    1903             :         {
    1904             :             case token_type::uninitialized:
    1905           0 :                 return "<uninitialized>";
    1906             :             case token_type::literal_true:
    1907           0 :                 return "true literal";
    1908             :             case token_type::literal_false:
    1909           0 :                 return "false literal";
    1910             :             case token_type::literal_null:
    1911           0 :                 return "null literal";
    1912             :             case token_type::value_string:
    1913           0 :                 return "string literal";
    1914             :             case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
    1915             :             case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
    1916             :             case lexer::token_type::value_float:
    1917           0 :                 return "number literal";
    1918             :             case token_type::begin_array:
    1919           0 :                 return "'['";
    1920             :             case token_type::begin_object:
    1921           0 :                 return "'{'";
    1922             :             case token_type::end_array:
    1923           0 :                 return "']'";
    1924             :             case token_type::end_object:
    1925           0 :                 return "'}'";
    1926             :             case token_type::name_separator:
    1927           0 :                 return "':'";
    1928             :             case token_type::value_separator:
    1929           0 :                 return "','";
    1930             :             case token_type::parse_error:
    1931           0 :                 return "<parse error>";
    1932             :             case token_type::end_of_input:
    1933           0 :                 return "end of input";
    1934             :             case token_type::literal_or_value:
    1935           0 :                 return "'[', '{', or a literal";
    1936             :             default: // catch non-enum values
    1937             :                 return "unknown token"; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
    1938             :         }
    1939             :     }
    1940             : 
    1941           5 :     explicit lexer(detail::input_adapter_t adapter)
    1942          10 :         : ia(std::move(adapter)), decimal_point_char(get_decimal_point()) {}
    1943             : 
    1944             :     // delete because of pointer members
    1945             :     lexer(const lexer&) = delete;
    1946             :     lexer& operator=(lexer&) = delete;
    1947             : 
    1948             :   private:
    1949             :     /////////////////////
    1950             :     // locales
    1951             :     /////////////////////
    1952             : 
    1953             :     /// return the locale-dependent decimal point
    1954           5 :     static char get_decimal_point() noexcept
    1955             :     {
    1956           5 :         const auto loc = localeconv();
    1957           5 :         assert(loc != nullptr);
    1958           5 :         return (loc->decimal_point == nullptr) ? '.' : *(loc->decimal_point);
    1959             :     }
    1960             : 
    1961             :     /////////////////////
    1962             :     // scan functions
    1963             :     /////////////////////
    1964             : 
    1965             :     /*!
    1966             :     @brief get codepoint from 4 hex characters following `\u`
    1967             : 
    1968             :     For input "\u c1 c2 c3 c4" the codepoint is:
    1969             :       (c1 * 0x1000) + (c2 * 0x0100) + (c3 * 0x0010) + c4
    1970             :     = (c1 << 12) + (c2 << 8) + (c3 << 4) + (c4 << 0)
    1971             : 
    1972             :     Furthermore, the possible characters '0'..'9', 'A'..'F', and 'a'..'f'
    1973             :     must be converted to the integers 0x0..0x9, 0xA..0xF, 0xA..0xF, resp. The
    1974             :     conversion is done by subtracting the offset (0x30, 0x37, and 0x57)
    1975             :     between the ASCII value of the character and the desired integer value.
    1976             : 
    1977             :     @return codepoint (0x0000..0xFFFF) or -1 in case of an error (e.g. EOF or
    1978             :             non-hex character)
    1979             :     */
    1980           0 :     int get_codepoint()
    1981             :     {
    1982             :         // this function only makes sense after reading `\u`
    1983           0 :         assert(current == 'u');
    1984           0 :         int codepoint = 0;
    1985             : 
    1986           0 :         const auto factors = { 12, 8, 4, 0 };
    1987           0 :         for (const auto factor : factors)
    1988             :         {
    1989           0 :             get();
    1990             : 
    1991           0 :             if (current >= '0' and current <= '9')
    1992             :             {
    1993           0 :                 codepoint += ((current - 0x30) << factor);
    1994             :             }
    1995           0 :             else if (current >= 'A' and current <= 'F')
    1996             :             {
    1997           0 :                 codepoint += ((current - 0x37) << factor);
    1998             :             }
    1999           0 :             else if (current >= 'a' and current <= 'f')
    2000             :             {
    2001           0 :                 codepoint += ((current - 0x57) << factor);
    2002             :             }
    2003             :             else
    2004             :             {
    2005           0 :                 return -1;
    2006             :             }
    2007             :         }
    2008             : 
    2009           0 :         assert(0x0000 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0xFFFF);
    2010           0 :         return codepoint;
    2011             :     }
    2012             : 
    2013             :     /*!
    2014             :     @brief check if the next byte(s) are inside a given range
    2015             : 
    2016             :     Adds the current byte and, for each passed range, reads a new byte and
    2017             :     checks if it is inside the range. If a violation was detected, set up an
    2018             :     error message and return false. Otherwise, return true.
    2019             : 
    2020             :     @param[in] ranges  list of integers; interpreted as list of pairs of
    2021             :                        inclusive lower and upper bound, respectively
    2022             : 
    2023             :     @pre The passed list @a ranges must have 2, 4, or 6 elements; that is,
    2024             :          1, 2, or 3 pairs. This precondition is enforced by an assertion.
    2025             : 
    2026             :     @return true if and only if no range violation was detected
    2027             :     */
    2028           0 :     bool next_byte_in_range(std::initializer_list<int> ranges)
    2029             :     {
    2030           0 :         assert(ranges.size() == 2 or ranges.size() == 4 or ranges.size() == 6);
    2031           0 :         add(current);
    2032             : 
    2033           0 :         for (auto range = ranges.begin(); range != ranges.end(); ++range)
    2034             :         {
    2035           0 :             get();
    2036           0 :             if (JSON_LIKELY(*range <= current and current <= *(++range)))
    2037             :             {
    2038           0 :                 add(current);
    2039             :             }
    2040             :             else
    2041             :             {
    2042           0 :                 error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
    2043           0 :                 return false;
    2044             :             }
    2045             :         }
    2046             : 
    2047           0 :         return true;
    2048             :     }
    2049             : 
    2050             :     /*!
    2051             :     @brief scan a string literal
    2052             : 
    2053             :     This function scans a string according to Sect. 7 of RFC 7159. While
    2054             :     scanning, bytes are escaped and copied into buffer token_buffer. Then the
    2055             :     function returns successfully, token_buffer is *not* null-terminated (as it
    2056             :     may contain \0 bytes), and token_buffer.size() is the number of bytes in the
    2057             :     string.
    2058             : 
    2059             :     @return token_type::value_string if string could be successfully scanned,
    2060             :             token_type::parse_error otherwise
    2061             : 
    2062             :     @note In case of errors, variable error_message contains a textual
    2063             :           description.
    2064             :     */
    2065         135 :     token_type scan_string()
    2066             :     {
    2067             :         // reset token_buffer (ignore opening quote)
    2068         135 :         reset();
    2069             : 
    2070             :         // we entered the function by reading an open quote
    2071         135 :         assert(current == '\"');
    2072             : 
    2073        1855 :         while (true)
    2074             :         {
    2075             :             // get next character
    2076        1990 :             switch (get())
    2077             :             {
    2078             :                 // end of file while parsing string
    2079             :                 case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
    2080             :                 {
    2081           0 :                     error_message = "invalid string: missing closing quote";
    2082           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2083             :                 }
    2084             : 
    2085             :                 // closing quote
    2086             :                 case '\"':
    2087             :                 {
    2088         135 :                     return token_type::value_string;
    2089             :                 }
    2090             : 
    2091             :                 // escapes
    2092             :                 case '\\':
    2093             :                 {
    2094           0 :                     switch (get())
    2095             :                     {
    2096             :                         // quotation mark
    2097             :                         case '\"':
    2098           0 :                             add('\"');
    2099           0 :                             break;
    2100             :                         // reverse solidus
    2101             :                         case '\\':
    2102           0 :                             add('\\');
    2103           0 :                             break;
    2104             :                         // solidus
    2105             :                         case '/':
    2106           0 :                             add('/');
    2107           0 :                             break;
    2108             :                         // backspace
    2109             :                         case 'b':
    2110           0 :                             add('\b');
    2111           0 :                             break;
    2112             :                         // form feed
    2113             :                         case 'f':
    2114           0 :                             add('\f');
    2115           0 :                             break;
    2116             :                         // line feed
    2117             :                         case 'n':
    2118           0 :                             add('\n');
    2119           0 :                             break;
    2120             :                         // carriage return
    2121             :                         case 'r':
    2122           0 :                             add('\r');
    2123           0 :                             break;
    2124             :                         // tab
    2125             :                         case 't':
    2126           0 :                             add('\t');
    2127           0 :                             break;
    2128             : 
    2129             :                         // unicode escapes
    2130             :                         case 'u':
    2131             :                         {
    2132           0 :                             const int codepoint1 = get_codepoint();
    2133           0 :                             int codepoint = codepoint1; // start with codepoint1
    2134             : 
    2135           0 :                             if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint1 == -1))
    2136             :                             {
    2137           0 :                                 error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
    2138           0 :                                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2139             :                             }
    2140             : 
    2141             :                             // check if code point is a high surrogate
    2142           0 :                             if (0xD800 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
    2143             :                             {
    2144             :                                 // expect next \uxxxx entry
    2145           0 :                                 if (JSON_LIKELY(get() == '\\' and get() == 'u'))
    2146             :                                 {
    2147           0 :                                     const int codepoint2 = get_codepoint();
    2148             : 
    2149           0 :                                     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint2 == -1))
    2150             :                                     {
    2151           0 :                                         error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
    2152           0 :                                         return token_type::parse_error;
    2153             :                                     }
    2154             : 
    2155             :                                     // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
    2156           0 :                                     if (JSON_LIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint2 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF))
    2157             :                                     {
    2158             :                                         // overwrite codepoint
    2159           0 :                                         codepoint =
    2160             :                                             // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
    2161           0 :                                             (codepoint1 << 10)
    2162             :                                             // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
    2163           0 :                                             + codepoint2
    2164             :                                             // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
    2165             :                                             // in the result so we have to subtract with:
    2166             :                                             // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
    2167             :                                             - 0x35FDC00;
    2168             :                                     }
    2169             :                                     else
    2170             :                                     {
    2171           0 :                                         error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
    2172           0 :                                         return token_type::parse_error;
    2173             :                                     }
    2174             :                                 }
    2175             :                                 else
    2176             :                                 {
    2177           0 :                                     error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
    2178           0 :                                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2179           0 :                                 }
    2180             :                             }
    2181             :                             else
    2182             :                             {
    2183           0 :                                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDFFF))
    2184             :                                 {
    2185           0 :                                     error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must follow U+D800..U+DBFF";
    2186           0 :                                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2187             :                                 }
    2188             :                             }
    2189             : 
    2190             :                             // result of the above calculation yields a proper codepoint
    2191           0 :                             assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
    2192             : 
    2193             :                             // translate codepoint into bytes
    2194           0 :                             if (codepoint < 0x80)
    2195             :                             {
    2196             :                                 // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
    2197           0 :                                 add(codepoint);
    2198             :                             }
    2199           0 :                             else if (codepoint <= 0x7FF)
    2200             :                             {
    2201             :                                 // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
    2202           0 :                                 add(0xC0 | (codepoint >> 6));
    2203           0 :                                 add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
    2204             :                             }
    2205           0 :                             else if (codepoint <= 0xFFFF)
    2206             :                             {
    2207             :                                 // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
    2208           0 :                                 add(0xE0 | (codepoint >> 12));
    2209           0 :                                 add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
    2210           0 :                                 add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
    2211             :                             }
    2212             :                             else
    2213             :                             {
    2214             :                                 // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
    2215           0 :                                 add(0xF0 | (codepoint >> 18));
    2216           0 :                                 add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F));
    2217           0 :                                 add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
    2218           0 :                                 add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
    2219             :                             }
    2220             : 
    2221           0 :                             break;
    2222             :                         }
    2223             : 
    2224             :                         // other characters after escape
    2225             :                         default:
    2226           0 :                             error_message = "invalid string: forbidden character after backslash";
    2227           0 :                             return token_type::parse_error;
    2228             :                     }
    2229             : 
    2230           0 :                     break;
    2231             :                 }
    2232             :

    2470             :                     {
    2471           0 :                         return token_type::parse_error;
    2472             :                     }
    2473           0 :                     break;

    2475             :

    2477             :                 case 0xF4:
    2478             :                 {
    2479           0 :                     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x8F, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
    2480             :                     {
    2481           0 :                         return token_type::parse_error;
    2482             :                     }
    2483           0 :                     break;
    2484             :                 }
    2485             : 
    2486             :                 // remaining bytes (80..C1 and F5..FF) are ill-formed
    2487             :                 default:
    2488             :                 {
    2489           0 :                     error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
    2490           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2491             :                 }
    2492             :             }
    2493             :         }
    2494             :     }
    2495             : 
    2496             :     static void strtof(float& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
    2497             :     {
    2498             :         f = std::strtof(str, endptr);
    2499             :     }
    2500             : 
    2501           0 :     static void strtof(double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
    2502             :     {
    2503           0 :         f = std::strtod(str, endptr);
    2504           0 :     }
    2505             : 
    2506             :     static void strtof(long double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
    2507             :     {
    2508             :         f = std::strtold(str, endptr);
    2509             :     }
    2510             : 
    2511             :     /*!
    2512             :     @brief scan a number literal
    2513             : 
    2514             :     This function scans a string according to Sect. 6 of RFC 7159.
    2515             : 
    2516             :     The function is realized with a deterministic finite state machine derived
    2517             :     from the grammar described in RFC 7159. Starting in state "init", the
    2518             :     input is read and used to determined the next state. Only state "done"
    2519             :     accepts the number. State "error" is a trap state to model errors. In the
    2520             :     table below, "anything" means any character but the ones listed before.
    2521             : 
    2522             :     state    | 0        | 1-9      | e E      | +       | -       | .        | anything
    2523             :     ---------|----------|----------|----------|---------|---------|----------|-----------
    2524             :     init     | zero     | any1     | [error]  | [error] | minus   | [error]  | [error]
    2525             :     minus    | zero     | any1     | [error]  | [error] | [error] | [error]  | [error]
    2526             :     zero     | done     | done     | exponent | done    | done    | decimal1 | done
    2527             :     any1     | any1     | any1     | exponent | done    | done    | decimal1 | done
    2528             :     decimal1 | decimal2 | [error]  | [error]  | [error] | [error] | [error]  | [error]
    2529             :     decimal2 | decimal2 | decimal2 | exponent | done    | done    | done     | done
    2530             :     exponent | any2     | any2     | [error]  | sign    | sign    | [error]  | [error]
    2531             :     sign     | any2     | any2     | [error]  | [error] | [error] | [error]  | [error]
    2532             :     any2     | any2     | any2     | done     | done    | done    | done     | done
    2533             : 
    2534             :     The state machine is realized with one label per state (prefixed with
    2535             :     "scan_number_") and `goto` statements between them. The state machine
    2536             :     contains cycles, but any cycle can be left when EOF is read. Therefore,
    2537             :     the function is guaranteed to terminate.
    2538             : 
    2539             :     During scanning, the read bytes are stored in token_buffer. This string is
    2540             :     then converted to a signed integer, an unsigned integer, or a
    2541             :     floating-point number.
    2542             : 
    2543             :     @return token_type::value_unsigned, token_type::value_integer, or
    2544             :             token_type::value_float if number could be successfully scanned,
    2545             :             token_type::parse_error otherwise
    2546             : 
    2547             :     @note The scanner is independent of the current locale. Internally, the
    2548             :           locale's decimal point is used instead of `.` to work with the
    2549             :           locale-dependent converters.
    2550             :     */
    2551           0 :     token_type scan_number()
    2552             :     {
    2553             :         // reset token_buffer to store the number's bytes
    2554           0 :         reset();
    2555             : 
    2556             :         // the type of the parsed number; initially set to unsigned; will be
    2557             :         // changed if minus sign, decimal point or exponent is read
    2558           0 :         token_type number_type = token_type::value_unsigned;
    2559             : 
    2560             :         // state (init): we just found out we need to scan a number
    2561           0 :         switch (current)
    2562             :         {
    2563             :             case '-':
    2564             :             {
    2565           0 :                 add(current);
    2566           0 :                 goto scan_number_minus;
    2567             :             }
    2568             : 
    2569             :             case '0':
    2570             :             {
    2571           0 :                 add(current);
    2572           0 :                 goto scan_number_zero;
    2573             :             }
    2574             : 
    2575             :             case '1':
    2576             :             case '2':
    2577             :             case '3':
    2578             :             case '4':
    2579             :             case '5':
    2580             :             case '6':
    2581             :             case '7':
    2582             :             case '8':
    2583             :             case '9':
    2584             :             {
    2585           0 :                 add(current);
    2586           0 :                 goto scan_number_any1;
    2587             :             }
    2588             : 
    2589             :             default:
    2590             :             {
    2591             :                 // all other characters are rejected outside scan_number()
    2592             :                 assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
    2593             :             }
    2594             :         }
    2595             : 
    2596             : scan_number_minus:
    2597             :         // state: we just parsed a leading minus sign
    2598           0 :         number_type = token_type::value_integer;
    2599           0 :         switch (get())
    2600             :         {
    2601             :             case '0':
    2602             :             {
    2603           0 :                 add(current);
    2604           0 :                 goto scan_number_zero;
    2605             :             }
    2606             : 
    2607             :             case '1':
    2608             :             case '2':
    2609             :             case '3':
    2610             :             case '4':
    2611             :             case '5':
    2612             :             case '6':
    2613             :             case '7':
    2614             :             case '8':
    2615             :             case '9':
    2616             :             {
    2617           0 :                 add(current);
    2618           0 :                 goto scan_number_any1;
    2619             :             }
    2620             : 
    2621             :             default:
    2622             :             {
    2623           0 :                 error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '-'";
    2624           0 :                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2625             :             }
    2626             :         }
    2627             : 
    2628             : scan_number_zero:
    2629             :         // state: we just parse a zero (maybe with a leading minus sign)
    2630           0 :         switch (get())
    2631             :         {
    2632             :             case '.':
    2633             :             {
    2634           0 :                 add(decimal_point_char);
    2635           0 :                 goto scan_number_decimal1;
    2636             :             }
    2637             : 
    2638             :             case 'e':
    2639             :             case 'E':
    2640             :             {
    2641           0 :                 add(current);
    2642           0 :                 goto scan_number_exponent;
    2643             :             }
    2644             : 
    2645             :             default:
    2646           0 :                 goto scan_number_done;
    2647             :         }
    2648             : 
    2649             : scan_number_any1:
    2650             :         // state: we just parsed a number 0-9 (maybe with a leading minus sign)
    2651           0 :         switch (get())
    2652             :         {
    2653             :             case '0':
    2654             :             case '1':
    2655             :             case '2':
    2656             :             case '3':
    2657             :             case '4':
    2658             :             case '5':
    2659             :             case '6':
    2660             :             case '7':
    2661             :             case '8':
    2662             :             case '9':
    2663             :             {
    2664           0 :                 add(current);
    2665           0 :                 goto scan_number_any1;
    2666             :             }
    2667             : 
    2668             :             case '.':
    2669             :             {
    2670           0 :                 add(decimal_point_char);
    2671           0 :                 goto scan_number_decimal1;
    2672             :             }
    2673             : 
    2674             :             case 'e':
    2675             :             case 'E':
    2676             :             {
    2677           0 :                 add(current);
    2678           0 :                 goto scan_number_exponent;
    2679             :             }
    2680             : 
    2681             :             default:
    2682           0 :                 goto scan_number_done;
    2683             :         }
    2684             : 
    2685             : scan_number_decimal1:
    2686             :         // state: we just parsed a decimal point
    2687           0 :         number_type = token_type::value_float;
    2688           0 :         switch (get())
    2689             :         {
    2690             :             case '0':
    2691             :             case '1':
    2692             :             case '2':
    2693             :             case '3':
    2694             :             case '4':
    2695             :             case '5':
    2696             :             case '6':
    2697             :             case '7':
    2698             :             case '8':
    2699             :             case '9':
    2700             :             {
    2701           0 :                 add(current);
    2702           0 :                 goto scan_number_decimal2;
    2703             :             }
    2704             : 
    2705             :             default:
    2706             :             {
    2707           0 :                 error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '.'";
    2708           0 :                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2709             :             }
    2710             :         }
    2711             : 
    2712             : scan_number_decimal2:
    2713             :         // we just parsed at least one number after a decimal point
    2714           0 :         switch (get())
    2715             :         {
    2716             :             case '0':
    2717             :             case '1':
    2718             :             case '2':
    2719             :             case '3':
    2720             :             case '4':
    2721             :             case '5':
    2722             :             case '6':
    2723             :             case '7':

    2725             :             case '9':
    2726             :             {
    2727           0 :                 add(current);
    2728           0 :                 goto scan_number_decimal2;
    2729             :             }
    2730             : 
    2731             :             case 'e':
    2732             :             case 'E':
    2733             :             {
    2734           0 :                 add(current);
    2735           0 :                 goto scan_number_exponent;
    2736             :             }
    2737             : 
    2738             :             default:
    2739           0 :                 goto scan_number_done;
    2740             :         }
    2741             : 
    2742             : scan_number_exponent:
    2743             :         // we just parsed an exponent
    2744           0 :         number_type = token_type::value_float;
    2745           0 :         switch (get())

    2747             :             case '+':

    2750           0 :                 add(current);

    2763             :             case '9':
    2764             :             {
    2765           0 :                 add(current);
    2766           0 :                 goto scan_number_any2;
    2767             :             }
    2768             : 
    2769             :             default:
    2770             :             {
    2771           0 :                 error_message =
    2772             :                     "invalid number; expected '+', '-', or digit after exponent";

    2774             :             }
    2775             :         }

    2777             : scan_number_sign:

    2788             :             case '7':
    2789             :             case '8':
    2790             :             case '9':
    2791             :             {
    2792           0 :                 add(current);
    2793           0 :                 goto scan_number_any2;
    2794             :             }
    2795             : 
    2796             :             default:
    2797             :             {
    2798           0 :                 error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after exponent sign";
    2799           0 :                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2800             :             }
    2801             :         }
    2802             : 
    2803             : scan_number_any2:
    2804             :         // we just parsed a number after the exponent or exponent sign
    2805           0 :         switch (get())
    2806             :         {
    2807             :             case '0':

    2817             :             {
    2818           0 :                 add(current);
    2819           0 :                 goto scan_number_any2;
    2820             :             }
    2821             : 
    2822             :             default:
    2823           0 :                 goto scan_number_done;
    2824             :         }
    2825             : 
    2826             : scan_number_done:
    2827             :         // unget the character after the number (we only read it to know that
    2828             :         // we are done scanning a number)
    2829           0 :         unget();
    2830             : 
    2831           0 :         char* endptr = nullptr;
    2832           0 :         errno = 0;
    2833             : 
    2834             :         // try to parse integers first and fall back to floats
    2835           0 :         if (number_type == token_type::value_unsigned)
    2836             :         {
    2837           0 :             const auto x = std::strtoull(token_buffer.data(), &endptr, 10);
    2838             : 
    2839             :             // we checked the number format before
    2840           0 :             assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
    2841             : 
    2842           0 :             if (errno == 0)
    2843             :             {
    2844           0 :                 value_unsigned = static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(x);
    2845           0 :                 if (value_unsigned == x)
    2846             :                 {
    2847           0 :                     return token_type::value_unsigned;
    2848             :                 }
    2849             :             }
    2850             :         }
    2851           0 :         else if (number_type == token_type::value_integer)
    2852             :         {

    2854             : 
    2855             :             // we checked the number format before

    2865             :             }
    2866             :         }

    2869             :         // integer conversion above failed
    2870           0 :         strtof(value_float, token_buffer.data(), &endptr);
    2871             : 
    2872             :         // we checked the number format before
    2873           0 :         assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
    2874             : 
    2875           0 :         return token_type::value_float;
    2876             :     }
    2877             : 
    2878             :     /*!
    2879             :     @param[in] literal_text  the literal text to expect
    2880             :     @param[in] length        the length of the passed literal text
    2881             :     @param[in] return_type   the token type to return on success
    2882             :     */
    2883           0 :     token_type scan_literal(const char* literal_text, const std::size_t length,
    2884             :                             token_type return_type)
    2885             :     {
    2886           0 :         assert(current == literal_text[0]);
    2887           0 :         for (std::size_t i = 1; i < length; ++i)
    2888             :         {
    2889           0 :             if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get() != literal_text[i]))
    2890             :             {
    2891           0 :                 error_message = "invalid literal";
    2892           0 :                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2893             :             }
    2894             :         }
    2895           0 :         return return_type;
    2896             :     }
    2897             : 
    2898             :     /////////////////////
    2899             :     // input management
    2900             :     /////////////////////
    2901             : 
    2902             :     /// reset token_buffer; current character is beginning of token
    2903         135 :     void reset() noexcept
    2904             :     {
    2905         135 :         token_buffer.clear();
    2906         135 :         token_string.clear();
    2907         135 :         token_string.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(current));
    2908         135 :     }
    2909             : 
    2910             :     /*
    2911             :     @brief get next character from the input
    2912             : 
    2913             :     This function provides the interface to the used input adapter. It does
    2914             :     not throw in case the input reached EOF, but returns a
    2915             :     `std::char_traits<char>::eof()` in that case.  Stores the scanned characters
    2916             :     for use in error messages.
    2917             : 
    2918             :     @return character read from the input
    2919             :     */
    2920        3845 :     std::char_traits<char>::int_type get()
    2921             :     {
    2922        3845 :         ++chars_read;
    2923        3845 :         current = ia->get_character();
    2924        3845 :         if (JSON_LIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
    2925             :         {
    2926        3840 :             token_string.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(current));
    2927             :         }
    2928        3845 :         return current;
    2929             :     }
    2930             : 
    2931             :     /// unget current character (return it again on next get)
    2932           0 :     void unget()
    2933             :     {
    2934           0 :         --chars_read;
    2935           0 :         if (JSON_LIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
    2936             :         {
    2937           0 :             ia->unget_character();
    2938           0 :             assert(token_string.size() != 0);
    2939           0 :             token_string.pop_back();
    2940             :         }
    2941           0 :     }
    2942             :

    2945             :     {
    2946        1855 :         token_buffer.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(c));
    2947        1855 :     }

    2987             : 
    2988             :     /// return the last read token (for errors only).  Will never contain EOF
    2989             :     /// (an arbitrary value that is not a valid char value, often -1), because
    2990             :     /// 255 may legitimately occur.  May contain NUL, which should be escaped.
    2991           0 :     std::string get_token_string() const
    2992             :     {
    2993             :         // escape control characters
    2994           0 :         std::string result;
    2995           0 :         for (const auto c : token_string)
    2996             :         {
    2997           0 :             if ('\x00' <= c and c <= '\x1F')
    2998             :             {
    2999             :                 // escape control characters
    3000           0 :                 std::stringstream ss;
    3001           0 :                 ss << "<U+" << std::setw(4) << std::uppercase << std::setfill('0')
    3002           0 :                    << std::hex << static_cast<int>(c) << ">";
    3003           0 :                 result += ss.str();
    3004             :             }
    3005             :             else
    3006             :             {
    3007             :                 // add character as is
    3008           0 :                 result.push_back(c);
    3009             :             }
    3010             :         }
    3011             : 
    3012           0 :         return result;
    3013             :     }
    3014             : 
    3015             :     /// return syntax error message
    3016           0 :     constexpr const char* get_error_message() const noexcept
    3017             :     {
    3018           0 :         return error_message;
    3019             :     }
    3020             : 
    3021             :     /////////////////////
    3022             :     // actual scanner
    3023             :     /////////////////////
    3024             : 
    3025        1855 :     token_type scan()
    3026             :     {
    3027             :         // read next character and ignore whitespace
    3028        1495 :         do
    3029             :         {
    3030        1855 :             get();
    3031             :         }
    3032        1855 :         while (current == ' ' or current == '\t' or current == '\n' or current == '\r');
    3033             : 
    3034         360 :         switch (current)
    3035             :         {
    3036             :             // structural characters
    3037             :             case '[':
    3038          10 :                 return token_type::begin_array;
    3039             :             case ']':
    3040          10 :                 return token_type::end_array;
    3041             :             case '{':
    3042          35 :                 return token_type::begin_object;
    3043             :             case '}':
    3044          35 :                 return token_type::end_object;
    3045             :             case ':':
    3046          80 :                 return token_type::name_separator;
    3047             :             case ',':
    3048          50 :                 return token_type::value_separator;
    3049             : 
    3050             :             // literals
    3051             :             case 't':
    3052           0 :                 return scan_literal("true", 4, token_type::literal_true);
    3053             :             case 'f':
    3054           0 :                 return scan_literal("false", 5, token_type::literal_false);
    3055             :             case 'n':
    3056           0 :                 return scan_literal("null", 4, token_type::literal_null);
    3057             : 
    3058             :             // string
    3059             :             case '\"':
    3060         135 :                 return scan_string();
    3061             : 
    3062             :             // number
    3063             :             case '-':
    3064             :             case '0':
    3065             :             case '1':
    3066             :             case '2':
    3067             :             case '3':
    3068             :             case '4':
    3069             :             case '5':
    3070             :             case '6':
    3071             :             case '7':
    3072             :             case '8':
    3073             :             case '9':
    3074           0 :                 return scan_number();
    3075             : 
    3076             :             // end of input (the null byte is needed when parsing from
    3077             :             // string literals)
    3078             :             case '\0':
    3079             :             case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
    3080           5 :                 return token_type::end_of_input;
    3081             : 
    3082             :             // error
    3083             :             default:
    3084           0 :                 error_message = "invalid literal";
    3085           0 :                 return token_type::parse_error;
    3086             :         }
    3087             :     }
    3088             : 
    3089             :   private:
    3090             :     /// input adapter
    3091             :     detail::input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;

    3148             : /*!
    3149             : @brief syntax analysis
    3150             : 
    3151             : This class implements a recursive decent parser.
    3152             : */
    3153             : template<typename BasicJsonType>
    3154           5 : class parser
    3155             : {
    3156             :     using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
    3157             :     using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;

    3160             :     using lexer_t = lexer<BasicJsonType>;
    3161             :     using token_type = typename lexer_t::token_type;
    3162             : 
    3163             :   public:
    3164             :     enum class parse_event_t : uint8_t
    3165             :     {
    3166             :         /// the parser read `{` and started to process a JSON object
    3167             :         object_start,
    3168             :         /// the parser read `}` and finished processing a JSON object
    3169             :         object_end,
    3170             :         /// the parser read `[` and started to process a JSON array
    3171             :         array_start,
    3172             :         /// the parser read `]` and finished processing a JSON array
    3173             :         array_end,
    3174             :         /// the parser read a key of a value in an object
    3175             :         key,
    3176             :         /// the parser finished reading a JSON value
    3177             :         value
    3178             :     };
    3179             : 
    3180             :     using parser_callback_t =
    3181             :         std::function<bool(int depth, parse_event_t event, BasicJsonType& parsed)>;
    3182             : 
    3183             :     /// a parser reading from an input adapter
    3184           5 :     explicit parser(detail::input_adapter_t adapter,
    3185             :                     const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
    3186             :                     const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
    3187           5 :         : callback(cb), m_lexer(adapter), allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
    3188           5 :     {}
    3189             : 
    3190             :     /*!
    3191             :     @brief public parser interface
    3192             : 
    3193             :     @param[in] strict      whether to expect the last token to be EOF
    3194             :     @param[in,out] result  parsed JSON value
    3195             : 
    3196             :     @throw parse_error.101 in case of an unexpected token
    3197             :     @throw parse_error.102 if to_unicode fails or surrogate error
    3198             :     @throw parse_error.103 if to_unicode fails
    3199             :     */
    3200           5 :     void parse(const bool strict, BasicJsonType& result)
    3201             :     {
    3202             :         // read first token
    3203           5 :         get_token();
    3204             : 
    3205           5 :         parse_internal(true, result);
    3206           5 :         result.assert_invariant();
    3207             : 
    3208             :         // in strict mode, input must be completely read
    3209           5 :         if (strict)
    3210             :         {
    3211           5 :             get_token();
    3212           5 :             expect(token_type::end_of_input);
    3213             :         }
    3214             : 
    3215             :         // in case of an error, return discarded value
    3216           5 :         if (errored)
    3217             :         {
    3218           0 :             result = value_t::discarded;
    3219           0 :             return;
    3220             :         }
    3221             : 
    3222             :         // set top-level value to null if it was discarded by the callback
    3223             :         // function
    3224           5 :         if (result.is_discarded())
    3225             :         {
    3226           0 :             result = nullptr;
    3227             :         }
    3228             :     }
    3229             : 
    3230             :     /*!
    3231             :     @brief public accept interface
    3232             : 
    3233             :     @param[in] strict  whether to expect the last token to be EOF
    3234             :     @return whether the input is a proper JSON text
    3235             :     */
    3236             :     bool accept(const bool strict = true)
    3237             :     {
    3238             :         // read first token
    3239             :         get_token();
    3240             : 
    3241             :         if (not accept_internal())
    3242             :         {
    3243             :             return false;
    3244             :         }
    3245             : 
    3246             :         // strict => last token must be EOF
    3247             :         return not strict or (get_token() == token_type::end_of_input);
    3248             :     }
    3249             : 
    3250             :   private:
    3251             :     /*!

    3258             :     {
    3259             :         // never parse after a parse error was detected
    3260         100 :         assert(not errored);
    3261             :

    3534             :     }
    3535             : 
    3536             :     /*!
    3537             :     @brief the actual acceptor
    3538             : 
    3539             :     @invariant 1. The last token is not yet processed. Therefore, the caller
    3540             :                   of this function must make sure a token has been read.
    3541             :                2. When this function returns, the last token is processed.
    3542             :                   That is, the last read character was already considered.
    3543             : 
    3544             :     This invariant makes sure that no token needs to be "unput".
    3545             :     */
    3546             :     bool accept_internal()
    3547             :     {
    3548             :         switch (last_token)
    3549             :         {
    3550             :             case token_type::begin_object:
    3551             :             {
    3552             :                 // read next token
    3553             :                 get_token();
    3554             : 
    3555             :                 // closing } -> we are done
    3556             :                 if (last_token == token_type::end_object)
    3557             :                 {
    3558             :                     return true;
    3559             :                 }
    3560             : 
    3561             :                 // parse values
    3562             :                 while (true)
    3563             :                 {
    3564             :                     // parse key
    3565             :                     if (last_token != token_type::value_string)
    3566             :                     {
    3567             :                         return false;
    3568             :                     }
    3569             : 
    3570             :                     // parse separator (:)
    3571             :                     get_token();
    3572             :                     if (last_token != token_type::name_separator)
    3573             :                     {
    3574             :                         return false;
    3575             :                     }
    3576             : 
    3577             :                     // parse value
    3578             :                     get_token();
    3579             :                     if (not accept_internal())
    3580             :                     {
    3581             :                         return false;
    3582             :                     }
    3583             : 
    3584             :                     // comma -> next value
    3585             :                     get_token();
    3586             :                     if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
    3587             :                     {
    3588             :                         get_token();
    3589             :                         continue;
    3590             :                     }
    3591             : 
    3592             :                     // closing }
    3593             :                     return (last_token == token_type::end_object);
    3594             :                 }
    3595             :             }
    3596             : 
    3597             :             case token_type::begin_array:
    3598             :             {
    3599             :                 // read next token
    3600             :                 get_token();
    3601             : 
    3602             :                 // closing ] -> we are done

    3604             :                 {

    3614             :                         return false;
    3615             :                     }
    3616             : 
    3617             :                     // comma -> next value

    3627             :                 }

    3629             : 
    3630             :             case token_type::value_float:
    3631             :             {
    3632             :                 // reject infinity or NAN
    3633             :                 return std::isfinite(m_lexer.get_number_float());
    3634             :             }

    3640             :             case token_type::value_string:
